citation.article-title: Pyrodictium, a new genus of submarine disc-shaped sulfur reducing archaebacteria growing optimally at 105C.

p.s: Pyrodictium (Pyr.o.dic'ti.um. Gr. neurt. n. pry fire, gr. neutr. n. dikryon network, M.L. neutr. n. Pyrodictium, the fire network)
Cells disc- to dish-shaped, highly irregular in diameter from 0.3 to 2.5 μm, about 0.2 μm thick, forming fibres, 0.04 to 0.08 μm thick, which build networks connecting the cells.
Packed cells have a whitish to greyish colour.
Growth in unshaken-cultures as a cobweb-like layer above the sulphur.
Growth at least up to 110°C with an optimum 105° (at 200 kPa).
Growth between pH 5.0 and 7.0 and between 0.2 and 12% NaCl.
Ribosomes are ADP-ribosylated by diptheria toxin.
Pyrite is formed during growth in the fermenter.
Type species is Pyrodictium occultum PL-19, DSM 2709, Göttingen, FRG.
